intro: Senecio squalidus subsp. aurasiacus, commonly known as the Afghan groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing adaptability to harsh conditions. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers arranged in a composite head. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and diverse ecological roles. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
